title: Publish Version 1 and Version 2 as separately deployed apps on different URLs (no in-app version selector)

requirements.text: Remove the single-app ‚Äúversion selection‚Äù entry flow and change the frontend so Version 1 and Version 2 can be published as two separate standalone deployments, each with its own distinct URL and its own root route ('/').

quotes: Not in one page I wanted that different link for both versions like publish them differently

acceptanceCriteria: There is no user-facing version-selection screen required to access Version 1 vs Version 2 (each version is accessed by its own deployment URL).
Version 1 loads directly at its own URL on '/' (no need to visit '/v1' first).
Version 2 loads directly at its own URL on '/' (no need to visit '/v2' first).
Both URLs can be opened simultaneously in two browser tabs/windows and function independently.

requirements.text: Ensure each standalone deployment preserves all existing behaviors and exact texts for its version: Version 1 uses heading text exactly "Cia will you be mine forever or will stay for lifetime? ‚ù§Ô∏è" and Version 2 uses heading text exactly "Khusnul will you be mine forever or will stay for lifetime? ‚ù§Ô∏è"; both keep the existing "Yes üíñ" navigation to the success screen and the evasive "No üíî" behavior unchanged.

quotes: Not in one page I wanted that different link for both versions like publish them differently

acceptanceCriteria: In the Version 1 deployment, the question screen heading is exactly: "Cia will you be mine forever or will stay for lifetime? ‚ù§Ô∏è".
In the Version 2 deployment, the question screen heading is exactly: "Khusnul will you be mine forever or will stay for lifetime? ‚ù§Ô∏è".
In both deployments, clicking/tapping "Yes üíñ" shows the existing success screen with the exact existing success text/subtext and existing heart/confetti-style animation.
In both deployments, the "No üíî" button remains evasive with the same fixed-position random movement rules and click/tap safety behavior as currently implemented.

requirements.text: Add/adjust project build + deploy configuration so developers can produce and deploy two distinct frontend artifacts (Version 1 and Version 2) from the same repo, without requiring manual code edits between deployments.

quotes: different link for both versions like publish them differently

acceptanceCriteria: There is a documented, repeatable way to build/deploy Version 1 and Version 2 as separate standalone frontends producing two different published URLs.
Switching between Version 1 and Version 2 for deployment is controlled via configuration (e.g., build-time setting) rather than editing source files each time.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI library sources).
Do not modify Internet Identity hooks under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts / .tsx or frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts (immutable paths).
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are required for this request.
nonGoals: Do not add new app features beyond separating deployments/URLs for Version 1 and Version 2.
Do not change the romantic theme, button labels, success text, or evasive button mechanics.
Do not add additional versions beyond Version 1 and Version 2.
